intro: Callisthene erythroclada, commonly known as the red-veined mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with red veins. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to red, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
